intro: Lophochlaena californica var. davyi, commonly known as the California lophochlaena, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest understories and stream banks. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a distinctive pungent odor, while its flowers are small and white to greenish in color. This variety is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and growth habit compared to the typical form of Lophochlaena californica.
